The race of Africa saw the expansion of the French, Belgian, German, British, Dutch, and Italian empires. Spain did make African colonies which were then lost. After WW1 France, Britain, the Netherlands, Belgium, and Portugal held Africa. After WW2 all these European powers started to let go of their colonies. So to answer the main colonizers would be the British, French, Spanish, Dutch, and Portuguese. They made lasting effects on their colonies, unlike other European powers. They also had big empires.

Main Colonizers The main European countries active in this form of colonization included Spain, Portugal, France, the Kingdom of England (later Great Britain), the Netherlands, and the Kingdom of Prussia (now Germany), and, beginning in the 18th century, the United States.
